page.title: 03Housing
page.content: There are about 70 houses including 7{ {Coastguard Cottages}which are 100 yrs old and are now privately owned and 11 chalets at Chine Farm(sometimes used as holiday homes.)Many of the houses are very old{Walpen Manor,Little {Atherfield Farm and Atherfield Farm {House which was originally a Manor {house are all mentioned in the {original Domesday Book.}A 17th.Century cottage called{Goodalls'}is said to have been a smuggler's cottage and later used as a farm and a school. Properties which are between 100-300 years old are built of stone and have thatched roofs although at least two have slate roofs.Renovation and extentions have taken place but we only know of 6 properties which have been built in the last 50yrs-the oldest of these is a red brick house, the others being chalet type bungalows
